summary: This document is a Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) record of a Loan and Security Agreement between HELIBRO LLC and 157 SOURCE BANK, securing a loan with a Bell 407 helicopter (tail number N405PJ) as collateral. It includes the original agreement from April 7, 2016, and a subsequent aircraft registration renewal application from January 2019. This document is a Loan and Security Agreement and related Schedule A and Irrevocable De-Registration and Export Request Authorization (IDERA) between Helibro, LLC (Customer) and 1st Source Bank (Bank). It details a loan secured by a Bell 407 helicopter (registration N405P1), establishing the bank's security interest and control over the aircraft, including provisions under the Cape Town Convention. This document is a compilation of FAA and Transport Canada aircraft registration records for a Bell 407 helicopter (serial number 53375) with various U.S. tail numbers (N61161, N407RB, N491GM, N405PJ). It traces the ownership and registration history from 1999 to 2016, showing transfers between corporate entities including Bell Helicopter Textron Inc., Air Ghislaine Inc., Shmitka Air Inc., Copter Lease LLC Trustee, and Helibro LLC. The records include bills of sale, deregistration notices, and international flight declarations.

David Gunsauls (for Helibro, LLC) and Greg M. Hoist's institution (1st Source Bank) are parties to the aircraft loan and security documents.
Sonnenberg is the President/Managing Member representing Copter Lease LLC Trustee in aircraft transactions.
O'Reilly is the President of Eagle Copters Ltd., which sold the aircraft to Copter Lease LLC Trustee.
Indyke is the Vice President of Shmitka Air, Inc., which owned the aircraft in 2010.
Mixon is a Sr. Manager at Bell Helicopter Textron Inc., involved in the 2000 export of the aircraft.
Brown was a Commercial Aircraft Completion & Delivery employee at Bell Helicopter Textron, Inc. in 1999.

events.title: Loan and Security Agreement Execution
events.description: HELIBRO LLC and 157 SOURCE BANK execute a Loan and Security Agreement, using a Bell 407 helicopter (N405PJ) as collateral.

events.title: Security Conveyance Recorded with FAA
events.description: The FAA's Civil Aviation Registry records the security conveyance (number SY000344) for aircraft N405PJ, filed by 157 SOURCE Bank against HELIBRO LLC.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Renewal Filed
events.description: Mark Gunsauls signs and files an Aircraft Registration Renewal Application for helicopter N405PJ on behalf of HELIBRO LLC.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Expiration
events.description: The registration for aircraft N405PJ is set to expire on this date, per the renewal application.

events.title: Execution of Loan and Security Agreement
events.description: Helibro, LLC and 1st Source Bank entered into a Loan and Security Agreement for a loan secured by a Bell 407 helicopter.

events.title: Execution of Irrevocable De-Registration and Export Request Authorization (IDERA)
events.description: Helibro, LLC executed an IDERA in favor of 1st Source Bank, granting the bank sole authority to de-register and export the aircraft from the U.S. in case of default.

events.title: Aircraft Manufacture and Initial U.S. Registration
events.description: Bell Helicopter Textron Inc. requests a U.S. registration number for a newly manufactured Bell 407 (s/n 53375). It is initially registered as N61161.

events.title: Special Registration Number Assignment
events.description: The aircraft's registration number is changed to N407RB.

events.title: Deregistration and Export to United Kingdom
events.description: The aircraft (N407RB) is deregistered from the U.S. registry and exported to the United Kingdom at the request of Bell Helicopter Textron Inc.

events.title: Aircraft Transferred from UK to US, Registered to Air Ghislaine Inc.
events.description: The aircraft is removed from the UK register (where it was G-IORB) and registered in the U.S. as N491GM to Air Ghislaine Inc.

events.title: International Flight Declaration (West Palm Beach to Nassau)
events.description: Shmitka Air, Inc. declares an international flight for N491GM from West Palm Beach, Florida to Nassau, Bahamas on March 2, 2010.

events.title: Deregistration and Export to Canada
events.description: The aircraft (N491GM) is deregistered from the U.S. registry and exported to Canada at the request of Copter Lease LLC Trustee.

events.title: Aircraft Removed from Canadian Register
events.description: Transport Canada confirms the aircraft (C-GPVS) was removed from the Canadian Civil Aircraft Register.

events.title: Aircraft Registered to Helibro LLC
events.description: The aircraft is registered in the U.S. as N405PJ to Helibro LLC of Red Bluff, California.

keyFacts: HELIBRO LLC, based in Red Bluff, California, used a Bell 407 helicopter (tail number N405PJ) as collateral for a loan from 157 SOURCE Bank.
The Loan and Security Agreement was executed on April 7, 2016, and the security interest was officially recorded with the FAA on June 3, 2016.
Mark Gunsauls signed an FAA Aircraft Registration Renewal Application for the helicopter on January 2, 2019, on behalf of HELIBRO LLC.
The document is a standard FAA financial recordation form, showing a secured transaction unrelated to any direct criminal activity mentioned in this excerpt.
The helicopter's registration was set to expire on April 30, 2019, and the renewal was filed to prevent its cancellation.
Helibro, LLC obtained a loan from 1st Source Bank secured by a 1999 Bell Helicopter 407 (serial number 53375, FAA registration N405P1).

The agreement includes an Irrevocable De-Registration and Export Request Authorization (IDERA), granting the bank sole power to de-register the aircraft from the FAA and export it from the U.S. in the event of a default.
The security interest is registered under the Cape Town Convention, an international treaty governing interests in mobile equipment like aircraft.

Helibro, LLC certified it met U.S. citizenship requirements for FAA aircraft registration, including that its president is a U.S. citizen and at least 75% of its voting interest is owned by U.S. citizens.
The Bell 407 helicopter (s/n 53375) was owned by Air Ghislaine Inc. in 2002, a company name directly referencing Ghislaine Maxwell.
In 2010, the aircraft (N491GM) was owned by Shmitka Air, Inc. and a flight was declared from West Palm Beach, FL to Nassau, Bahamas.
The aircraft's registration trail shows it moved between the U.S., UK, Canada, and back to the U.S. between 1999 and 2016.
Corporate entities involved in ownership include Bell Helicopter Textron Inc., Air Ghislaine Inc., Shmitka Air Inc., Copter Lease LLC Trustee, and Helibro LLC.
The document set includes FAA forms, bills of sale, deregistration requests, and international flight declarations, providing a paper trail for the asset.
